column4: Hi. I have two hard drives with two different ubuntu operating systems installed. I want to remove one of the ubuntu's and install fedora. I can handle the install, but does anyone know how to look at my hard drives and then format the hard drive that has the ubuntu that I don't want?
Use cfdisk, that's more standard conformant.
You may partition the drive with cfdisk. Sample usage: cfdisk /dev/hda
Becareful with any drive partitioner though.
